pullRequest.body:
Prove the [Doob-Dynkin lemma](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doob–Dynkin_lemma): let `f : X → Y` and `g : X → Z` be such that `g` is strongly measurable with respect to the pullback by `f`. Then under the right assumptions on `Z` there exists a measurable function `h : Y → Z` such that `g = h ∘ f`.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [ff46cd5739](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/22743/commits/ff46cd573943fa163f7ae5e2bbb41d28b68b1fef)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Function.FactorsThrough | 2063 | 2071 | +8 (+0.39%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Function.FactorsThrough` `Mathlib.Probability.Kernel.IonescuTulcea.Traj`|8|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ StronglyMeasurable.measurableSet_exists_tendsto`
`+ _root_.Function.extend_val_apply'`
`+ exists_eq_measurable_comp`
`+ limUnder_of_not_tendsto`
`+ stronglyMeasurable_limUnder`
`+-+ induction`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

You shouldn't need the `NeBot` assumption here, if you start your proof with
```
  rcases eq_or_neBot l with rfl | hl
  · simp only [limUnder, lim, Filter.map_bot, bot_le]
    exact stronglyMeasurable_const
```
I'm not sure this lemma and the next one belong to this file: they are general results on strongly measurable functions.

It feels really strange to have algebraic assumptions on `Z` here: isn't the theorem true in general? (If you restrict to the closure of the range of `g`, you have a Polish space, so everything should be well-behaved...)

For what it's worth: I managed to replace `[AddZeroClass Z] [ContinuousAdd Z]` with `[Nonempty Z]`, but I had to go back to `MeasureTheory.Function.SimpleFunc` and `MeasureTheory.Function.StronglyMeasurable.Basic` to give alternate versions of `induction` therein, which do not rely on the algebraic structure (basically, you need the propositions to be true on constants and stable under measurable `piecewise`).

Maybe there's something more clever to do, but if needed, I can give the code (which might need some cleaning).

pullRequest.title: feat: if `g` is measurable wrt to the pullback by `f` then `g` is a measurable function of `f`
